intro: Culcita schlimensis, commonly known as Schlim's culcita, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of small, violet-colored flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a hairy texture. Culcita schlimensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats.
